alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 17 at 11:26PM CDT until May 18 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Douglas County in east central Kansas... Southeastern Jefferson County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 200 AM CDT. * At 1126 PM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northern Lawrence, Perry, Lecompton, Williamstown and Perry Lake. This includes the following highways... Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 203 and 205. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
